channel.title: Comments on: Version 1.24.4
channel.description: Brings your projects to your pocket

item.title: By: Valerio Mazzeo
item.dc:creator: Valerio Mazzeo
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../index.html#comment-1218">Abdurehim</a>.
Hi Abdurehim,
Push notifications have been implemented since January 2017, but unfortunately the GitLab server team is ignoring my requirements to have them work.
As of today is still a no go, as they say there isn’t enough interest from people in order to develop this integration.
You can register your interest here https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/29488
Apologies, that doesn't help your case.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Abdurehim.

Hi Abdurehim,

Push notifications have been implemented since January 2017, but unfortunately the GitLab server team is ignoring my requirements to have them work.

As of today is still a no go, as they say there isn’t enough interest from people in order to develop this integration.

You can register your interest here https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/29488

Apologies, that doesn’t help your case.

item.title: By: Abdurehim
item.dc:creator: Abdurehim
item.description: Hello. I've been using Gitlab Control iOS App for some time now, and I'm planning to upgrade. I want to know one thing though: in the full version, can I get notifications when someone in my team send a commit on the projects I'm participated in? I really need this feature and that's why I want to try the pro version in the first place. Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
Hello.
I’ve been using Gitlab Control iOS App for some time now, and I’m planning to upgrade. I want to know one thing though: in the full version, can I get notifications when someone in my team send a commit on the projects I’m participated in? I really need this feature and that’s why I want to try the pro version in the first place.
Thanks.
